item.title: UK withdraws Tehran embassy staff as US-Iran tension sparks concern across region
item.content:encoded: The US embassy in Israel has also told some non-emergency staff they can leave the country if they wish.

item.title: Government to give go-ahead for £1bn defence helicopter deal

item.title: Green victory shows insurgent parties are here to stay

item.title: Starmer says he will fight on after by-election defeat to Greens

item.title: Reform UK reports by-election 'family voting' concerns to police
item.content:encoded: It comes after election observers raised concerns about "extremely high" levels of family voting.

item.content:encoded: Paramount beats Netflix to the major deal, pleasing figures in DC and LA alike, the BBC's culture and media editor writes.

item.title: Waitrose to suspend mackerel sales due to overfishing concerns
item.content:encoded: The supermarket chain says it will stop sourcing fresh, chilled and frozen mackerel by 29 April.

item.title: Why are Afghanistan and Pakistan fighting?
item.content:encoded: The two sides have different versions of how and why the deadly dispute began.

item.title: Prem relegation scrapped from 2026-27 season
item.content:encoded: Traditional promotion and relegation to and from the Prem will be scrapped from the 2026-27 season as landmark changes to the English game are voted through.

item.title: Spanish opposition calls for disgraced ex-monarch to return from exile
item.content:encoded: The 88-year-old Juan Carlos should spend his last years in dignity, the leader of Spain's main opposition party says.

item.title: SSE Airtricity to reduce gas prices by 8% from April
item.content:encoded: It means the annual gas bill of a typical household with a credit meter will reduce by £80 a year.

item.title: Soham killer Huntley still in hospital after attack using makeshift weapon
item.content:encoded: Huntley, who is serving a life sentence for murdering two schoolgirls, has significant head trauma, the BBC understands.
